embeds.title: Broken Tooth
embeds.description:
Uncommon Relic / All / Downfall

Whenever you beat an Elite encounter, gain 1 **Strength** :p_strength: at the start of each combat for the rest of the Act.
*Appears too large to have come from a human jaw...*

messages.content: cool relic, but i wish you didn't have to wait to get benefit from it
could stand to be 1 strength per elite you've already defeated in an act

getting this as your relic after beating your last elite is an awful feeling
yeah
true
Yeah relics with no immediate benefits kinda suck tbh

it's okay during normal play but in the final act it's worse vajra and it ticks me off
it's not " worse vajra" in act 4 it's nothing in act 4
oh wait never mind I see what you mean

too strong tbh
comparable to girya but doesn't have a cap

i could accept that

especially during downfall runs because the 3 adventurers are WAY harder than the spire shield and spear

while this relic can be frustrating to get at inopportune moments I do think that its solid overall. It generally gives the same value as satchel of courage but you get the strength for the whole act half way through and sometimes you can go on an elite killing rampage taking out 4, 5 or sometimes even 6 of them and steamroll the floors boss with +6 strength for free.

its notably better on gremlins then other characters because they have a lot of multi hit cards and actively want to seek out elites because elites so that they can overpower the bosses without hopefully taking any casualties with the relics (also because the gremlins only have a bad match up vs sentries and do well vs every other elite)

There are enough downfall characters that really benefit from strength scaling (guardian, hexaghost, collector, champ, automaton, gremlins) that this relic is usually pretty good. It would really be appreciated if it either counter all elites beaten in the act (retroactively), or if it counted the elite you just beat to get it. Can certainly be frustrating to get this at a weird time (halfway or more through the act) and have it be dead for quite a long time. I like that it encourages taking on as many elites as you can, and that it actively helps to make that easier by giving you extra damage in those fights. It's also usually giving +2 or +3 strength by the time you reach the act boss, which can be very helpful.

As long as the timing is reasonable, I'm happy to see this as a random drop, and I often consider buying it from a shop if I am on a path where I can take 3+ elites and have some good potions to help me beat the first one comfortably. It can be pretty awkward in act 4, since it's just giving you 1 strength against neow, but it usually does plenty of work before that point to be fine. I could see putting a floor limit on this relic being reasonable, since finding it in late act 3 means it's very close to a blank.
